title: Transmuter (SpliceHack)
data:
- *This article is about the SpliceHack monster. For SLASH'EM quest nemesis, see [Transmuter](/wiki/Transmuter "Transmuter").*

* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* [can eat metal](/wiki/Metallivore "Metallivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |                                                                                                            |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | [SpliceHack 1.1.0 monst.c L2873](https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/monst.c#L2873) |

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") a **transmuter** is a monster that can change the [material](/wiki/Material "Material") of items.

The transmuter's claw attack will change the material of your armor. If you aren't wearing armor, your worn [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring") might be affected.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The transmuter's passive attack will warp the material of items and weapons used to strike it, including [pounding](/wiki/Pound "Pound") with [polearms](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") and [lances](/wiki/Lance "Lance") as well as attacking with [gloved](/wiki/Glove "Glove") hands.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [2 Messages](#Messages)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [5 References](#References)

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Object materials (SpliceHack)](/wiki/Object_materials_\(SpliceHack\) "Object materials (SpliceHack)")*

Uncontrolled material changes are undesirable, so in most cases transmuters should be fought with ranged weapons or spells.

However sometimes changing an object material is useful. In SpliceHack an armor's material can affect its [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"), and there are damage bonuses for using weapons made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), [copper](/wiki/Copper "Copper") and [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver"). Some materials such as [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril") are also immune to [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion"). A [scroll of change material](/wiki/Scroll_of_change_material "Scroll of change material") exists, but scrolls are single-use. An alternative option is to wield the item that needs to be warped, wear some [junk](/wiki/Junk "Junk"), and repeatedly hit the transmuter in melee until you get the material you want.

## Messages

- Your \[item] warps!

  The transmuter's passive attack changed the material of your item.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

- That's odd, you don't remember putting on a \[material] \[armor]...

  The transmuter's claw attack changed the material of your armor.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## History

Early versions of SpliceHack had a monster called a **substance warper**, which was renamed to **transmuter** in version 0.7.1.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Encyclopedia entry

Ask not, what your items can do to it. Ask what it can do to your items.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) <https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/uhitm.c#L3993>
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) <https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/uhitm.c#L6445>
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) <https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/uhitm.c#L6446>
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) <https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/uhitm.c#L4011>
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) <https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/commit/1273323d4839f3a7740795c3afa2e8a717742635>

Transmuter (SpliceHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
This article is about the SpliceHack monster. For SLASH'EM quest nemesis, see Transmuter.
R transmuter
Difficulty 14
Attacks Claw 2d2 change material, Passive 0d0 change material
R transmuter
Difficulty 14
Attacks

Claw 2d2 change material, Passive 0d0 change material

Base level 12
Base experience 164
Speed 12
Base AC 2
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 750
Nutritional value 200
Size Large
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A transmuter:

  • is an animal.
  • is omnivorous.
  • can eat metal.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference SpliceHack 1.1.0 monst.c L2873

In SpliceHack a transmuter is a monster that can change the material of items.

The transmuter's claw attack will change the material of your armor. If you aren't wearing armor, your worn rings might be affected.[1]

The transmuter's passive attack will warp the material of items and weapons used to strike it, including pounding with polearms and lances as well as attacking with gloved hands.[2]

Contents

  • 1 Strategy
  • 2 Messages
  • 3 History
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry
  • 5 References

Strategy

Main article: Object materials (SpliceHack)

Uncontrolled material changes are undesirable, so in most cases transmuters should be fought with ranged weapons or spells.

However sometimes changing an object material is useful. In SpliceHack an armor's material can affect its AC, and there are damage bonuses for using weapons made of iron, copper and silver. Some materials such as mithril are also immune to erosion. A scroll of change material exists, but scrolls are single-use. An alternative option is to wield the item that needs to be warped, wear some junk, and repeatedly hit the transmuter in melee until you get the material you want.

Messages

Your [item] warps!
The transmuter's passive attack changed the material of your item.[3]
That's odd, you don't remember putting on a [material] [armor]...
The transmuter's claw attack changed the material of your armor.[4]

History

Early versions of SpliceHack had a monster called a substance warper, which was renamed to transmuter in version 0.7.1.[5]

Encyclopedia entry

Ask not, what your items can do to it. Ask what it can do to your items.

References

  1. ↑ https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/uhitm.c#L3993
  2. ↑ https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/uhitm.c#L6445
  3. ↑ https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/uhitm.c#L6446
  4. ↑ https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/uhitm.c#L4011
  5. ↑ https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/commit/1273323d4839f3a7740795c3afa2e8a717742635

In [[SpliceHack]] a '''transmuter''' is a monster that can change the [[material]] of items.

The transmuter's claw attack will change the material of your armor. If you aren't wearing armor, your worn [[ring]]s might be affected.<ref>https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/uhitm.c#L3993</ref>

The transmuter's passive attack will warp the material of items and weapons used to strike it, including [[pound]]ing with [[polearm]]s and [[lance]]s as well as attacking with [[glove]]d hands.<ref>https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/uhitm.c#L6445</ref>

==Strategy==
{{main|Object materials (SpliceHack)}}
Uncontrolled material changes are undesirable, so in most cases transmuters should be fought with ranged weapons or spells.

However sometimes changing an object material is useful. In SpliceHack an armor's material can affect its [[AC]], and there are damage bonuses for using weapons made of [[iron]], [[copper]] and [[silver]]. Some materials such as [[mithril]] are also immune to [[erosion]]. A [[scroll of change material]] exists, but scrolls are single-use. An alternative option is to wield the item that needs to be warped, wear some [[junk]], and repeatedly hit the transmuter in melee until you get the material you want.

==Messages==
{{message|Your [item] warps!|The transmuter's passive attack changed the material of your item.<ref>https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/uhitm.c#L6446</ref>}}
{{message|That's odd, you don't remember putting on a [material] [armor]...|The transmuter's claw attack changed the material of your armor.<ref>https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/uhitm.c#L4011</ref>}}

==History==
Early versions of SpliceHack had a monster called a '''substance warper''', which was renamed to '''transmuter''' in version 0.7.1.<ref>https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/commit/1273323d4839f3a7740795c3afa2e8a717742635</ref>
